title: Update prettytable-rs to 0.10
body: This version contains a fix for the following advisory. https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gfgm-chr3-x6px

title: Update rustqlite to 0.28
body:
rustqlite is updated to version 0.28 to update the bundled version of SQLite to 3.39.2 which contains a fix for CVE-2022-35737. Looking at the vulnerability writeup by TrailOfBits the impact is likely limited to a denial service.

https://sqlite.org/releaselog/3_39_2.html
https://blog.trailofbits.com/2022/10/25/sqlite-vulnerability-july-2022-library-api/

title: Fix compilation on Windows under rust 1.56
Fix macOS build, version bump to 1.2.4
fix c_char type issue #106 for Linux aarch64
Create rust.yml
body:
Create a simple action to build siquery for Windows, macOS and Linux x86_64.

My first attempt at an action, to make it easier to detect build breaks

Remove the defunct azure-pipeline (it was designed to prepare artifacts for the CDN - creating 7z archives, hash files and building for defunct platforms - e.g. Linux x86)

title: Fix proxy-cfg on Linux
body: Fixed some other warnings and bump version to 1.2.3

title: Windows ARM64 portability
body: This pull request updates dependencies that would not compile on Windows ARM64 - siquery now correctly builds for Windows ARM64 :)

title: Re-worked schema tests to be more dynamic.
body:
I created two new tests JSON_SchemaValidation and EXE_SchemaValidation. These two perform the schema validation tests dynamically on all tables. 

Because of that I removed the schema tests from the individual table test files. I figure those can be used later once we start performing actual system query validation. 

I'd like to start adding the c# interface next / add some additional queries, but I'm not sure exactly where to start. Are there any OS queries that you think would be good to get started with? I was considering disk_encryption or disk_info.

title: Schema validation continued
body:
I re-organized the PS build process so that the complete module builds into package by default.

Re-organized the tests a little bit and started adding more.

title: Start using JSON schema
body:
- Start defining JSON schema for tables
- Add Pester tests to validate schema
- Remove "specialized" functions
- Improve build.ps1 script

title: First pass at creating a more dynamic frontend
body:
I re-arranged the existing functions, removed some from the base install, and then created New-SiqOSSpecificFunctions to create the rest of the available functions on a per-OS basis.

Feel free to pick and choose what you want to accept! I won't mind.

title: Update rusqlite to 0.23
body:
This pull request updates the rusqlite dependency to version 0.23, some security issues were fixed.

https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0014.html
https://github.com/rusqlite/rusqlite/releases/tag/0.23.0

rusqlite contains a number of breaking changes since version 0.14, to make the review easier here are the changes I applied.

`The trait implementation of VTab and VTabCursor is now unsafe`

The first member of structs implementing these traits must be sqlite3_vtab/sqlite3_vtab_cursor and they must be repr(C). I verified that these conditions are met.

`Rows::next returns Result<Option<&Row<'_>>> instead of Option<Result<Row<...>>>`

The pattern matching was changed to reflect this change, I also merged both match together to remove a layer of nesting.

`Row::get is now Row::get_checked, the previous method is now named Row::get_unwrap`

I replaced the calls to `get` with `get_unwrap`. The conditions were the code could panic shouldn't happen.

https://docs.rs/rusqlite/0.23.1/rusqlite/struct.Row.html#method.get_unwrap
